item.title: Dragon arrows
item.dc:creator: @iatchi1019 iatchi1019
item.description:
@iatchi1019 wrote:

it dont work. this is my thing

[code]/RANGE/
public boolean HasArrows = false;
public void DeleteArrow()
{
if(playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] == 0)
{
deleteequiment(playerEquipment[playerArrows], playerArrows);
}
if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] != 4214 && playerEquipment[playerWeapon] != 11785 && playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] != 0){
outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(34);
outStream.writeWord(1688);
outStream.writeByte(playerArrows);
outStream.writeWord(playerEquipment[playerArrows]+1);
if (playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] -1 > 254) {
outStream.writeByte(255);
outStream.writeDWord(playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] -1);
}
else {
outStream.writeByte(playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] -1); //amount
}
outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord();
playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] -= 1;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 11774){
HasArrows = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 11775){
HasArrows = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 11776){
HasArrows = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 11777){
HasArrows = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 11778){
HasArrows = true;
}
if (playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 11779){
HasArrows = true;
}
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}

public void CheckArrows()
{
for(int k = 880; k < 893; k++){

if(playerEquipment[playerArrows] == k){
HasArrows = true;
}
if(playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 11774) {
HasArrows = true;
}

if(playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 11775) {
HasArrows = true;
}

if(playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 11776) {
HasArrows = true;
}

if(playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 11777) {
HasArrows = true;
}

if(playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 11778) {
HasArrows = true;
}

if(playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 11779) {
HasArrows = true;
}
else if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 4214){
HasArrows = true;
}
else {
HasArrows = false;
}

}[/code]
if u get it to work ill give u ownership on my server

Read full topic

}[br][size=1]Posted on: October 15, 2007, 08:52:03 AM[/size][hr]so how do i make it so dragon arrows work[br][size=1]Posted on: October 15, 2007, 09:16:31 AM[/size][hr]will any1 answer me. how do i make it so the arrows actualy fire[/quote]

item.title: Dragon arrows
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“openice123, post:5, topic:151791”]to make them stackable is in item.java
search

data/stackable.dat

in item.java

and add

itemStackable[11774] = true;

between

[quote]}
dataIn.close();[/quote]

so it looks like

FileInputStream dataIn = new FileInputStream(new File("data/stackable.dat")); while ((c = dataIn.read()) != -1) { if (c == 0) itemStackable[counter] = false; else itemStackable[counter] = true; counter++; } itemStackable[11774] = true; dataIn.close(); } catch (IOException e) { System.out.println("Critical error while loading stackabledata! Trace:"); e.printStackTrace(); }

im not to sure about the graphics tho[/quote]

That might not work, on some servers, when you spawn the arrows, theyre stackable, but they dont show “dragon arrows”, they show pictures of crandor map pieces ETC…

To make them so it will fire, with arrows…
Search

/*RANGE*/

Scroll, till you see a method

CheckArrows() {

Or…

CheckArrowType() {

What ever your method might be called…

Then add the arrows, with your reset

|| playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 11774)

Yours might be differnt, depending on the method.

Read full topic

item.title: Dragon arrows
item.dc:creator: @iatchi1019 iatchi1019
item.description:
@iatchi1019 wrote:

i have a hasarrows boolean here it is.

public boolean HasArrows = false;
public void DeleteArrow()
{
if(playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] == 0)
{
deleteequipment(playerEquipment[playerArrows], playerArrows);
}
if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] != 4214 && playerEquipment[playerWeapon] != 11785 && playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] != 0){
outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(34);
outStream.writeWord(1688);
outStream.writeByte(playerArrows);
outStream.writeWord(playerEquipment[playerArrows]+1);
if (playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] -1 > 254) {
outStream.writeByte(255);
outStream.writeDWord(playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] -1);
}
else {
outStream.writeByte(playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] -1); //amount
}
outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord();
playerEquipmentN[playerArrows] -= 1;
}
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}

public void CheckArrows()
{
for(int k = 880; k < 893; k++){

if(playerEquipment[playerArrows] == k){
HasArrows = true;
}
else if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 4214){
HasArrows = true;
}
else {
HasArrows = false;
}

}

Read full topic

[/quote]

you mean so they arent a weapon?

if thats the case just add 11774 to

public static int arrows

in item.java

like openice said, make sure you have added the ID of your dragon arrows into

public static int arrows

which is in item.JAVA

you have to make sure that it is the correct ID. just because his ID is 11774, it doesn’t mean they are the same… he might of changed it.[/quote]

you calling me a liar? lol jk but it is the right id even check for yourself
